info.title: MockHat - Compliance with EU Regulations
info.introduction: At {{company}}, we are committed to complying with {{eu}} regulations, including the {{aiAct}} and the {{gdpr}}. Protecting your privacy, ensuring the security of your data, and using AI ethically are our top priorities.

aiAct.title: AI Act
aiAct.description: Ethical and Safe Use of AI
aiAct.content: The {{aiAct}} of the {{eu}} regulates the use of artificial intelligence to ensure safety and the protection of fundamental rights. Our platform complies with this law through:

list.transparency: Transparency: We explain how our AI systems work and the data they use.
list.riskManagement: Risk Management: We conduct rigorous audits to ensure the fairness and safety of our AI systems.
list.humanSupervision: Human Supervision: We ensure human intervention in critical decisions to prevent risks.

gdpr.title: GDPR
gdpr.content: The {{gdpr}} establishes how we handle personal data. We ensure compliance with its principles:

list.transparency: Transparency: We clearly explain how we process your data.
list.minimization: Data Minimization: We only collect the essential data.
list.security: Security: We use advanced measures such as encryption to protect your information.
list.servicesInEU: Services within the EU: All our services are hosted on servers located within the EU, adhering to strict European standards of security and privacy.
list.userRights: User Rights: You can access, rectify, delete, and port your data, as well as object to its use.

list.fairness: Fairness: We eliminate biases in our AI models to ensure fair treatment for all users.
list.anonymization: Data Anonymization: We never send personal data to our AI models. Any information used to train or improve model performance is anonymized to ensure users cannot be identified.

conclusion.title: Staying Up-to-Date
conclusion.content: We continuously update our platform to comply with evolving {{eu}} regulations.

legal.title: By continuing, you agree to the updated
legal.subtitle: and

termsOfSale.title: Terms of Sale
termsOfSale.content: These Terms of Sale govern the transactions made through the MockHat platform (hereinafter, 'we' or 'our'). By making a purchase, you agree to the terms described below.

sections.servicesDetails: 1.1. MockHat provides automated writing assessment services and related testing based on artificial intelligence. 1.2. Services are subject to availability and may be modified or suspended without prior notice.
sections.pricingDetails: 2.1. Service prices are indicated on the corresponding page and may vary depending on the selected plan. 2.2. Payments must be made in full before accessing the service. 2.3. We accept payments via [credit/debit cards, PayPal, etc.].
sections.refundsDetails: 3.1. Refunds are only available if the services have not been used within [X days] of purchase. 3.2. If you believe there has been a billing error, contact us at [support email].
sections.liabilityDetails: 4.1. MockHat is not responsible for errors in assessment or results derived from the use of the service. 4.2. Our maximum liability will be limited to the amount paid for the service.

termsOfService.title: Terms of Service
termsOfService.content: These Terms of Service govern your use of the MockHat platform. By accessing or using our site and services, you agree to the following terms.

sections.useDetails: 1.1. MockHat is designed to provide AI-based writing assessment tests. 1.2. You must be over 18 years old or have the consent of a legal guardian to use our services.
sections.accountDetails: 2.1. You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account and credentials. 2.2. MockHat reserves the right to suspend or delete accounts that violate these terms.
sections.prohibitionsDetails: 3.1. Using MockHat for illegal or unauthorized activities is prohibited. 3.2. You must not attempt to access, modify, or manipulate our systems or data.
sections.intellectualDetails: 4.1. All rights to the services, including algorithms and assessments, are the exclusive property of MockHat. 4.2. Unauthorized reproduction, distribution, or use of platform-generated content is prohibited.
sections.modificationsDetails: 5.1. MockHat may update these terms at any time. Changes will become effective once published on our site.
sections.liabilityDetails: 6.1. MockHat does not guarantee absolute accuracy of assessments and is not liable for decisions based on results. 6.2. Our maximum liability is limited to the cost of the service used.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.content: This Privacy Policy explains how MockHat collects, uses, and protects your personal information.

sections.dataDetails: 1.1. Personal Information: We collect data such as your name, email, and payment details when you register or use our services. 1.2. Technical Information: We collect data such as your IP address, browser type, and activity on our site to improve user experience.
sections.usageDetails: 2.1. We use your information to provide contracted services, improve our assessment tools, and send important notifications and promotional content (with your consent).
sections.retentionDetails: 3.1. We retain your information as necessary to fulfill the purposes described in this policy or as required by applicable laws.
sections.securityDetails: 4.1. We implement technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information from unauthorized access. However, no system is completely secure.
sections.rightsDetails: 5.1. You can access, correct, or delete your personal information by contacting us at [support email]. 5.2. You have the right to opt-out of promotional emails by clicking the 'unsubscribe' link in our emails.
sections.cookiesDetails: 6.1. We use cookies to enhance your experience on the site. You can configure your browser to disable cookies, but this may affect some site functionalities.
sections.changesDetails: 7.1. MockHat may update this policy at any time. Significant changes will be notified by publishing an update on our site.
